intro: Soda kerneri, commonly known as the soda Kerneri, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh, dry environments and often grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
